author: Staff Reporter
text:
Five schoolgirls, who had left home in a zest to tour through Bengaluru, were rescued by an alert conductor of State Transport Corporation here in Shoolagiri on Tuesday.

The girls, all 16-year-old, studying Plus-Two in a school in Valasalwalkam, had left school around noon on Tuesday and had boarded an SETC bus to Bengaluru.

However, conductor Devamani (29), who overheard their conversation, alerted the SETC office at Hosur. Following this, the SETC officials alerted the Hosur check-post police station, and later the Hosur All Women’s Police Station. The girls were secured to safety at the AWPS and their parents were informed. In the meantime, a complaint about the girls missing was already registered at Valsalwalkam police station.
title: Five schoolgirls rescued
